result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander S. Taft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber and/or Electronic Monitoring is approved at the discretion of the jail. May be served by 80 Hours of Community Service. Defendant chooses Community Service Hours.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander S. Taft

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Cases called at 1:27 PM: 21CF1156, 21CT239, 21CT386, 22CM609.
Defendant Alexander S. Taft in court with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Restitution has been paid in full. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CM609: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor; Repeater.  Repeater acknowledged.
Defendant is sentenced to 10 Days of Jail which may be completed by 80 Hours of Community service.  Huber and/or Electronic Monitoring is approved and at the jail's discretion.
Defendant chooses Community Service Hours.  $600 Fine plus Court Costs, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
21CT239: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Operating While Revoked and is sentenced to Court Costs/surcharges, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Defendant is not granted any sentence credit.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF1156, 21CT239, 21CT386, 22CM609 are called at 2:36 PM) No appearance by Defendant Alexander S. Taft in court or by Zoom.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Alexander S. Taft.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates the Defendant contacted her stating his ride was running late- requests adjournment. No objection by State. 
Status Conference: 10/28/2022 at 1:30 PM (IN PERSON)
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:29 AM cases 21CF1156, 21CT239, 21CT386, 22CM609 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander S. Taft in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Alexander S. Taft. Defense advises there is not an agreement at this time. 
A Status conference is scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 2:30 PM (15 min).
Initial appearance on August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:03 AM cases 21CT386, 21CT239, 22CM609, 21CF1156 called. Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexander S. Taft appeared by video via Zoom. Attorney Katherine Cook in court. 

22CM609: Defense acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives its reading. $100 signature bond with standard conditions ordered. Court orders Defendant to sign bond by 08/04/0222 at 4:30 PM. 

21CF1156: Defense acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives its reading. Defense enters not guilty pleas on Count 1 and 2. Court accepts pleas. 20 days for motions to be filed.

Branch 2 for scheduling Arraignment in all cases.

(Cases called at 9:03 AM - 21CF1156, 21CT239, 21CT386, 22CM609)
No appearance by Defendant Alexander Taft.  Attorney Katherine Cook appears.  Attorney Monica Fallon appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has no information as to the Defendant's non-appearance but has had good communication with him in the past.  Court does not see any other missed appearances in these cases.
Status Conference/Initial Appearance (on 22CM609): August 2, 2022 at 9:30 AM (intake)
